lines.text: Say, why don't you come in on that proposition I spoke to you about?
Well, eh, you didn't tell me just exactly what it was, Nifty.
You should worry what it is! There's a lot of Jack in it. Come on inside and we'll gab about it.
These joints he runs, they're bootleg, ain't they?
What of it? There ain't no danger. Except in that your arms might get lame once in awhile from countin' the dough you'll be making.
When I gave you this job, I told you never to bring that stuff here! You think I want the bulls to find it out?
Well, I...
You won't be well long, if you make another mistake like this! Now, get outta here before I blow you out!
Ah, quit your crabbin', will you.
I'll quit crabbin' when you explain why you took that saxophone money back from Danny!
You would squawk, wouldn't you.
Squawk? I ain't said a word. That collector fellow was here again.
Sometimes, I bet you wish you was free without a wife to bother you, huh, Johnny?
Nah!
You still love me?
What do you think!
Oh, I don't know. I'm afraid I nag you too much.
That's alright, Bert. Why, if it wasn't for scrapin' once in awhile, we'd never have nothin' to talk about.
Sufferin' swordfish!
Pick up your dogs!
Well, lift your big feet!

I know that wrong is wrong. And no amount of talkin' can make me see it otherwise. Can't you see your startin' going around with a lot of crooks and before you know it you'll be with 'em. Right down in the gutter! But, if that's where you're going, I ain't going with ya. I made up my mind, Johnny, I just come to this. You can take your choice. If that thing stays here, then, I'm going to leave.
Pick up the dice, Bert. You win.
A long while ago I asked could I get some sperm oil. I ain't seen it yet.
What would I be doing with sperm oil?
I wouldn't care to take a chance on none of them cheap oils. I guess I'll just have to spit on it.
That guy's a bull.
What?
A bull! I just now remembered. When Clancy's still blew up, I was there. That flat-footed mug come to investigate it.
Newton's a high-class crook or a copper. I don't know which.
As for you, baby, that last wham of yours just cleared the bases!
Well, what can you expect from a guy, whose own sister, makes his flat a meetin' place for a lot of bulls!
What's in the suitcase?
Hooch!
I can't hold no job or nothin'. I don't know why you married me? If you'd a married Bill Dugan, you'd be livin' in luxury now. Taxi drivers, gettin' forty a week!
Oh, Johnny, you, you done great work, Johnny. Oh, J, you used your bean, alright!
You dirty rat, John Quinlan! You skunk! You stool pigeon!
I've got a job for you. But, one Quinlan is enough in my office. I'm going to fire her.
Oh, what, Lottie?
Yes. I'm going to give her a better job. I think it's listed in civil service as, a, housewife.
Welcome to the family, Charlie!
